title: Pomegranate Juice Recipe for Babies
content:
Summer is here. It is absolutely crucial to feed as much liquid food to your baby either as water or in the form of juices. There are certain fruits which you should avoid for babies and certain fruits can be given for them. This series gives an idea about what fruit juice you can feed your baby and the best way to juice it. I hope it will help you.

 

I am starting with the most health packed fruit which is pomegranate, It cures digestive problems in babies, intestinal worms control fevers and has lots of liver protection problems. You can refer more to their properties here.

 

Things to remember before feeding baby:

 

1) No seeds of this should be given for babies. Only juice must be fed. 

2) Make sure you don't grind the white skin of the pomegranate. Remove all of them and grind only the seeds of pomegranate so the juice will be sweet.

3) If your juice is not that sweet, you can add some sweetener to it.

4) Don't feed this at night, morning and afternoon is a good time to feed juice for baby.

5) This won't cause gas problems or constipation in babies.

 

How to introduce solid food to your baby:

 

How to make Pomegranate Juice:

Take a firm fresh pomegranate. Make sure the pomegranate seeds are not sour, it should be sweet.

Cut them open. Take a wooden spoon or a ladle. Use the back of it bashes the pomegranate to get all the seeds out.

Now take the seeds alone in a blender and puree them.

Place a strainer over a bowl. Pour the puree over it and press with a spoon to get as much juice as possible.

Now pour the juice in a sipper or feeding bottle and feed your baby.
